Contradict fact: The claim that those in the Deferred Action on Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program are "mostly-adult illegal aliens" contradicts the fact that DACA recipients arrived in the United States as children.
Understate: The claim may understate the fact that DACA recipients were under the age of 16 when they arrived in the United States and had been living in the U.S. continuously since June 15, 2007.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that DACA recipients are "mostly-adult illegal aliens."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being an adult automatically makes someone an illegal alien, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that DACA recipients are individuals who were brought to the United States as children and have been living in the country for a significant period of time.
